task.summary: Upgrades! - put the new fresh STL's in - added a base to the model. - began to use lighting properly with the openGL stuff - fixed the colours - fixed the back clipping distance (openGL) - added math error protection - added joint limits (against eachother) protection - added collision protection via exclusive-angle polygon overlap checking
- Resize working properly - Can now fullscreen this thing - Added a logo icon to the window
- Resize working properly - Can now fullscreen this thing - Added a logo icon to the window

Orion5.p carries element angles in degrees without gearing applied and sends 'cytron degrees' over the serial.
Now the visualiser/controller has the gearbox scaler for the shoulder built into it, this is (1+(52/28)) and we will have to put this in clear wording somewhere as well into the basic matlab implementation. This should help stop the users overrunning the absolute limits and prevent an: advantaged offset situation, where it thinks 120deg is actually 0deg cause it rolled over... which could be dangerous to the hardware in terms of pulling cabling.
Logo funtimes, Added a preinitialiser for each scroll bar (6 axis control mechanism) Fixed torque off on visualiser listen mode (Key A)
Logo funtimes, Added a preinitialiser for each scroll bar (6 axis control mechanism) Fixed torque off on visualiser listen mode (Key A)

MESSAGE.value: Upgrades! - put the new fresh STL's in - added a base to the model. - began to use lighting properly with the openGL stuff - fixed the colours - fixed the back clipping distance (openGL) - added math error protection - added joint limits (against eachother) protection - added collision protection via exclusive-angle polygon overlap checking
- Resize working properly - Can now fullscreen this thing - Added a logo icon to the window

Orion5.p carries element angles in degrees without gearing applied and sends 'cytron degrees' over the serial.
Now the visualiser/controller has the gearbox scaler for the shoulder built into it, this is (1+(52/28)) and we will have to put this in clear wording somewhere as well into the basic matlab implementation. This should help stop the users overrunning the absolute limits and prevent an: advantaged offset situation, where it thinks 120deg is actually 0deg cause it rolled over... which could be dangerous to the hardware in terms of pulling cabling.
Logo funtimes, Added a preinitialiser for each scroll bar (6 axis control mechanism) Fixed torque off on visualiser listen mode (Key A)
